column11: Nice man made beach area with very good city views. Some families were out enjoying the area but it was not crowded at all. A fair bit of construction continues.

column8: Beautiful night views a relaxing seaside vibe
column11: A magical night at Port City ‚Äî the moon shining bright, waves calming the whole shoreline, and the skyline glowing behind us. The place was full of people enjoying the cool breeze, taking pictures, playing by the water, and soaking in the peaceful nightlife. We had such a relaxing and romantic experience together. The beach swing with the ‚ÄúPORT CITY‚Äù sign was the best spot ‚Äî simple, but it gives you that perfect calm seaside vibe. The whole atmosphere felt safe, open, and refreshing, with amazing views of the illuminated city.

column8: Not worth the Hype - Port City Colombo
column11: ‚∏ª üö´ Not Worth the Hype ‚Äì Port City Colombo Total letdown. No signs to the entertainment area, and you have to pay Rs. 200 one way for a shuttle that packs people in like a public bus. No receipts given, and the cashier was completely clueless‚Äîdidn‚Äôt even know his own number or have paper to note anything down. Once you get to the beach area, most of the rides don‚Äôt work. Only a small roller tube for kids and canoeing. The lifeguards were on their phones and looked like they didn‚Äôt care one bit. Facilities are a joke‚ÄîRs. 300 for kids and Rs. 500 for adults to use a filthy shower, and Rs. 50 for gross toilets. Leaving was worse‚Äîwe had to wait 45 minutes for a shuttle back, which was just as overcrowded. Total rip-off. Poorly run and not worth the trip. Won‚Äôt recommend. üëé ‚∏ª
The place was so crowded. Need more activities and organization around the place. Not good if you are aiming to go relax at the place.

The Slvar Footbridge and Port City is an area where development has just started.  There are some attractions in place, a bar and a point where you can take boat rides out, there is still much to do.  What is does have is a huge beach.  Apparently there are horses to ride though we didn‚Äôt see any we did see signs pointi8ng us to the stables.  The bridge is fantastic.

Port City Promenade ‚Äì Colombo‚Äôs Stunning Coastal Walkway The Port City Promenade is one of Colombo‚Äôs newest and most scenic public attractions, offering a modern waterfront experience with breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean. Located within the Colombo Port City development, this beautifully designed promenade is perfect for leisure walks, cycling, photography, and relaxation.
The man made beach is an excellent place for a sea swim. There is a food court with Asian ,burgers, and ice cream . The sunset Bar opens after 1400 hrs.
The bathrooms are awful. I mean where are there doors? And ever heard of toilets? Elsewise it would've been a 5. Beach is amazing
It's a nice area to walk and enjoy views of the city/skyline. It can get quite crowded on weekends and evenings. Not a whole lot of shade from the sun along the walking areas.

The Port City Promenade is family friendly with many options for recreation. I entered from the Plaza, which had a number of cafes and some lively music playing. Emerging on the other side, I found myself face to face with the Indian Ocean. I turned left and began to walk. In the distance, I could see the Shangri La and the One Galle Face. I think I saw a couple of adventurers enjoying kitesurfing too. It made me really happy to see the Port City was dog‚Äìfriendly with a dedicated play area for dogs! But it was difficult to walk on the sand with my shoes on. So, I moved to the cycling/ walking track running parallel to the beach. The evening breeze was soothing. I spent a good half an hour walking up and down the track, abrupting at least a couple of times a prewedding photoshoot that was going on.
Nice place to visit.boat ride at Sail lanka was realy interesting. 2 and a half hour boat ride in indian ocean, colombo was remarkable.

The Port City promenade is a wonderful place to visit if you're in Colombo. It is beautifully designed, spotlessly clean and over looks a marina. You will be able to have a fantastic view of the Colombo skyline, and multiple places to take great photos. Only a section of the promenade is currently open to the public, with more to be opened later including a beach area.
